This year's Invictus Games will take place in the Sydney Olympic Park, Australia. The opening ceremony will take place on Saturday October 20 at 7.30pm local time (10.30am BST, 2.30am PT, 5.30am ET). The sporting days will start from around 9am AEST each day, with the closing ceremony on October 27.Prince Harry came up with the idea for the Invictus Games in 2014 as a multi-sport event that allows armed forces personnel with injuries, sicknesses or wounds to compete and show what they can do. The word Invictus is Latin for "the unconquered" showing these competitors have not been bested by their traumas. The games themselves, held at the Sydney Olympic Park, vary from power lifting and track events to cycling and sailing. There are 11 medal sports in total and these include the likes of golf, swimming, cycling and wheelchair rugby. Over 500 service personnel from 18 countries will take part this year.The eighteen participatory countries for the Sydney Games include Afghanistan, Australia, Canada, Denmark, Estonia, France, Georgia, Germany, Iraq, Italy, Jordan, Netherlands, New Zealand, Poland, Romania, Ukraine, the United Kingdom and the United States.And the great news for those wanting to watch the Invictus Games at home? It's really easy to find a free live stream of Sydney 2018 - and from absolutely anywhere on Earth.This year ABC has the rights to the Invictus Games and will be sharing all the action live. The broadcaster is working with its ABC iview platform to share all the action live streamed, meaning you can catch it online via a laptop, tablet, TV, phone and more. This is also available via its YouTube channel here.You can also catch the fun and games via social media on Facebook, YouTube, Instagram and Twitter.And don't worry if you're out of the country and want to catch the live broadcast, as using a VPN will let you watch as if you were back at home on your laptop, mobile or other TV streaming device...Live stream the Invictus Games with a VPNIf you're desperate to watch every sporting event at the Invictus Games but nobody is broadcasting where you are, then you could always use a VPN to access it.
